body.value: poetry conference at UBC summer of 1963
Avison introduces poem by Charles Bukowski, first line “She had gone wrong somewhere...”
Reads section from a poem by Charles Bukowski “She had gone wrong somewhere...”
Introduces poem by Al Fowler first line “Quote: Are you a root or a tender mint     tea?”.
Reads poem by Al Fowler, first line “Quote: Are you a root or a tender mint tea?”.
Introduces poem by Gerry Gilbert called “Zoo”.
Reads poem by Gerry Gilbert, called  “Zoo”.
Introduces poem called “The Delinquent”  by unknown child.
Explains “The Delinquent”, Introduces poem, first line “Inside the TTC’s fence...”.
Reads first line “Inside the TTC’s fence...”.
Introduces “Is that You/Me Standing on My/Your Feet?”.
Reads “Is that You/Me Standing on My/Your Feet?”.
Introduces incomplete poems, first line “No instant morality for us...”.
one four-line stanza for the students
Reads first line “No instant morality for us...”.
Introduces incomplete poem, first line “The boy with the brilliant promises...”.
Reads first line “The boy with the brilliant promises...”.
Introduces "October 21, '66, at a bus stop on the way.".
Reads "October 21, '66, at a bus stop on the way.".
Introduces unknown poem first line “A junk truck stopped beside my bus...”.
dedicated to Jacques Ellul who wrote The Technological Society
Reads first line “A junk truck stopped beside my bus...”.
corner of Bathurst and     College Street in Toronto
Introduces poem Avison translated, called “Of Tyranny in One Breath” by Gyula     Illyes.
Reads “Of Tyranny in One Breath” by Gyula Illyes.
Explains “Of Tyranny in One Breath”, introduces “Bestialities”.
Introduces first line “Said the mite on the single page of a sad letter: Eureka...”.
Audience member interjects, asks her to read it without explanation.
Avison reads first line “Said the mite on the single page of a sad letter: Eureka...”.
Explains “Said the mite on the single page of a sad letter: Eureka...”.
Re-reads “Said the mite on the single page of a sad letter: Eureka...”.
Introduces poem, first line “The grackle shining in long grass...”.
Reads “The grackle shining in long grass...”.
